results.title: Taperturning
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
Three methods of taper turning are demonstrated and explained. 1. Offset tailstock. 2. Adjustment of compound slide. 3. Taper turning attachment.

results.title: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map
results.creator_credit: Binney and Smith, Art Products Division
results.brief_description: Russell Woody shows how to mix colour from a visual, rather than a theoretical perspective. Addresses how to select alternate colours to save money, how to correct failed colour mixes with minimal mixing, how to compare colours for opacity, outstanding coverage and transparency and glazes or washes. Provides an understanding of basic colour terms, how one colour can have several names, how words can distort colour vision and how to alleviate the problem.

results.title: An Impression of London
results.creator_credit: William Pollard, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: The round-the-clock activities of a typical London day described by a young American girl in her diary. Arriving by air at dawn, she explores London - the Tower of London, a search for the site of Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, feeding the pigeons in Trafalgar Square, a glimpse of the procession of the Household Cavalry at Hyde Park Corner, the streets, shops and parks, a visit to a riverside pub at dusk, dinner at a West End restaurant and a midnight cabaret.

results.title: An Illustration of basic film editing principles
results.brief_description: Leon Barsha of the American Cinema Editors has taken a sequence from the motion picture “Baby Face Nelson” to illustrate film editing techniques. Actors Mickey Rooney, Sir Cedric Hardwicke and Carolyn Jones are shown from our angle as on a stage. Then Leon Barsha shows how the same scene was heightened in mood and drama by editing with use of inserts - two shots, close-ups and extreme close-ups.

results.title: An Experiment in towns
results.creator_credit: John Reeve, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the reasons why Britain has recently built fifteen towns - to give healthier working conditions, closer proximity to work, and enable “men to lunch in their own homes”. Explains how the planned towns are designed to allow safe play for children and creative leisure for adults. Shows the good design of individual homes.

results.title: An Expedition into a volcano
results.brief_description: An expedition to Mount Nyiragongo, 11,000 feet above sea level - one of a chain of volcanoes in central East Africa. The expedition descends, terrace by terrace, to the lake of lava. Animated diagrams illustrate volcanic activity, then close shots of the lake show the mobility of molten lava, the formation of rocks, the burning of volcanic gases.

results.title: An Essay on war
results.creator_credit: Andrew A Rooney and Essay Productions
results.brief_description: Examines past and present reasons for waging war, the distance between those who declare war and those who fight it, the self-seeking of peacetime and the high productivity and united attitude of wartime, and the great ideals of war beside its horrible reality. Presents the positive and negative side of many moral questions related to war, and queries the need of civilised people to kill one another.

results.title: An Equation for progress
results.creator_credit: Ira Marvin, Joseph March and Ford Motor Company
results.brief_description: Documentary on the history of the Ford Motor Company. Early experiments, ultra-sonic steele-piercing beams, an analog computer, assimilated crashes and cars of the future.

results.title: An Englishman's horse
results.creator_credit: David Cammell, Jean Wadlow and Charles Barker Films
results.brief_description: The ancient partnership of man with horse is celebrated in this film. Two horse trials are featured showing something of just how tough a horse trial can be. Originally a form of cavalry training, it is the ultimate test of horse and rider.

results.title: An Electric talking picture
results.brief_description: An animated energy conservation film which is built around a wasteful young user of electricity and a wise old man who points out the folly of wasting electricity. Narrated by the comedy team of Bob and Ray
